# Arpeggio: add2 in E

## Brief Presentation
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played individually in a flowing manner rather than all together. In this case, we will focus on the add2 arpeggio in the key of E, which includes the notes E, F#, G#, B, and D#. The add2 refers to adding the second note of the E major scale to the chord, which is the F# note. This arpeggio gives a distinct flavor and can add a dreamy or ethereal quality to music when used effectively.

## Notes and Intervals
- E (Root)
- F# (Major 2nd)
- G# (Major 3rd)
- B (Perfect 5th)
- D# (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The add2 arpeggio in E is commonly used in genres such as ambient music, dream pop, and jazz to create a sense of space, tension, and resolution. The Major 7th interval adds a sense of sophistication and intrigue to the chord progression, while the Major 3rd and Perfect 5th provide stability and harmony. When played in a rhythmic or cascading pattern, this arpeggio can evoke a sense of longing or contemplation in a musical piece.
